document_data.mainbody:
Arvoreens amulets of aid were amulets imbued with Arvoreens benevolent divine magics.
These amulets were golden disks  in diameter with the holy symbol of Arvoreen the Defender inlaid in platinum.
Arvoreens amulets of aid held six charges of the aid spell. While more powerful exemplars also could cast the dimension door spell. Usage of each spell expended certain number of charges, aid - one, while dimension door - three. Due to the divine nature of these necklaces, they could only be used by creatures who did not venerate evil. If an evil being attempted to wear one of these amulets, they suffered a wave of weakness as if covered in negative energy. This weakness could not be alleviated by any means apart from discarding the amulet. If the wearer of Arvoreens amulets of aid ever attacked a goodly halfling, the necklace immodestly crumbled into dust.
Arvoreens amulets of aid could only be created by proficient hin wondrous item crafters. During the crafting process, the halfling needed to use aid and dimension door spells.
These goodly magical items gained popularity in the late 14 century DR and could be found invidious cities across the Sword Coast, not necessarily worn by halflings.
In 1372 DR, one of these amulets belonged to a planar-traveling wizard and merchant of the magical trinkets named Vejoni H. Wyzz‎‎ who pitched his pocket plane tent outside the town of Liams Hold.
*Daeghun Farlong, an ex-adventurer and the father of Kalach-Cha, the Knight-Commander of Crossroad Keep.
